summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2019 between Jeffrey Pagliuca, attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding coordination for Maxwell's grand jury subpoena and a potential proffer agreement, following the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. in Denver, Colorado, representing Ghislaine Maxwell. He is communicating with federal prosecutors to accept service of a grand jury subpoena and discuss a potential proffer agreement.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, appears to be a colleague of the Assistant U.S. Attorney or involved in the legal proceedings.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual to whom the grand jury subpoena is issued. Her attorney, Jeffrey Pagliuca, is negotiating the terms of her response and a potential proffer.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as 'Mr. Epstein,' whose indictment was under seal and scheduled to be unsealed. His presentment timing affects the scheduling of calls with Maxwell's attorney.

connections.description: Pagliuca identifies himself as authorized to accept service of a grand jury subpoena on behalf of Maxwell and seeks to discuss a proffer agreement with prosecutors on her behalf.
The legal correspondence concerns Maxwell's subpoena in the wake of Epstein's indictment, implying their legal matters are connected as part of the same investigation.
Both are copied on professional emails coordinating legal scheduling and document exchange related to the Maxwell subpoena.

events.title: Unsealing of Epstein Indictment
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney states the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein is under seal but anticipated to be unsealed and made publicly available.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Discussion Call
events.description: A call is scheduled between Maxwell's attorney and prosecutors to discuss a potential proffer agreement for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Initial Attorney- Prosecutor Contact
events.description: Jeffrey Pagliuca and an Assistant U.S. Attorney have an initial discussion, leading to Pagliuca accepting service of a grand jury subpoena for Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney, Jeffrey Pagliuca, accepted service of a grand jury subpoena for her testimony from the Southern District of New York.
Prosecutors were preparing to unseal the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein and were coordinating timing with Maxwell's legal team.
Discussions were underway for a potential proffer agreement from Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating early negotiation for cooperation.
The email chain shows direct, confidential communication between Maxwell's defense and federal prosecutors immediately following Epstein's arrest.
